text:
Credit Cards Auto Marissa Mayer Remaining Yahoo CEO with Twins on the Way Is a Big Sign of Progress Written by: Eric Reed 09/01/15 - 3:25 PM EDT NEW YORK (MainStreet) -- Tuesday brought the news that Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer is pregnant with identical twins. The hard-charging executive tasked with the search engine’s turnaround says that she’s taking her pregnancy in stride, writing in a blog post that since this is a “unique time in Yahoo’s transformation, I plan to approach the pregnancy and delivery as I did with my son three years ago, taking limited time away and working throughout.”
It’s wonderful news for the Mayer family. It’s also part of an increasing drip of good news for women in technology in general. 
Although gender gaps still pervade the workplace as a whole, nowhere is the issue so pronounced as in technology. According to a Department of Commerce study, women represent roughly one-quarter of the high-tech workforce and a bare 28% of STEM tenure-track faculty. Another U.S. Census report brings the dismal news that women’s participation in computer occupations has actually declined since the 1990s. 
Nevertheless, the idea of a major tech company’s CEO announcing both her pregnancy and her plans to remain at the helm throughout would have been almost unimaginable not long ago. Alongside raising awareness of the Silicon Valley boys’ club has come increasing progress toward taking it apart.
